title: Yearender 2024: Tech And Cyber Scams That Shook India In 2024
author: ETV Bharat Tech Team
summary: The year 2024 saw a surge in tech scams impacting India, revealing the evolving and malicious nature of cybercrime. Over 14 lakh cybercrime cases were registered between January 1 and November 11. These incidents highlight the growing need for digital vigilance.

scams.title: Deep Fake Video Promotions
scams.description: A deepfake video featuring cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar falsely promoting a game called Skyward Aviator Quest surfaced online. Tendulkar denounced the video and called for action against misinformation.

scams.title: Fake FedEx Courier Scam
scams.description: The CEO of a Bengaluru IT firm lost Rs 2.3 crore to scammers posing as FedEx executives and police officers, highlighting sophisticated methods of cyber fraud.

scams.title: Fake Investment Scheme
scams.description: A 75-year-old retired manager from Telangana lost Rs 13 crore in a WhatsApp investment scam. Scammers lured the victim with promises of high returns.

scams.title: Cyber Blackmail
scams.description: A 74-year-old man from Pune was blackmailed for Rs 97 lakh over five days by fraudsters posing as police officers. They used threats of legal action to extort money.

scams.title: Fake Trading App
scams.description: A retired ship captain in Mumbai lost Rs 11.16 crore after being lured into investing via a fake trading app through a WhatsApp group.

scams.title: Fake Supreme Court Hearing
scams.description: S P Oswal, a Padma Bhushan awardee, lost Rs 7 crore to scammers impersonating federal investigators and India's Chief Justice in a fabricated court hearing.

scams.title: Digital Arrest Scams
scams.description: A software engineer in Bengaluru lost Rs 11.8 crore over 18 days to scammers alleging his Aadhaar was linked to criminal activities and threatening arrest.

tips_to_stay_safe: Verify the identity of individuals contacting you, especially if they claim to represent an organization.
Be cautious of deepfake videos and audio clips. Verify content through official channels.
Avoid investment schemes promising unusually high returns without thorough research.
Report suspicious calls or messages threatening legal action or demanding money.
Use reputable trading apps and platforms recognized by financial authorities.
